other_tests.findings: Markedly elevated total plasma porphyrins (162.3 µg/dL; normal, 0-0.9 µg/dL), uroporphyrin I in urine (5040 nmol/L; normal, 0-90 nmol/L), coproporphyrin I in urine (48,160 nmol/L; normal, 0-300 nmol/L).
Homozygosity for the URO-synthase C73R mutation, confirming the diagnosis.
CD34-positive stem cells were successfully transplanted with subsequent normalization of hemoglobin.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Total plasma porphyrin levels decreased significantly to 20.7 µg/dL at 39 months of age, with marked improvement in skin fragility and tolerance to unlimited sunlight exposure.

other_tests.findings: Complete engraftment of donor stem cells.
